title: 110_s3720
content: TEMPORARY WAIVER OF REQUIRED MINIMUM DISTRIBUTION RULES FOR CERTAIN RETIREMENT PLANS AND ACCOUNTS. Temporary waiver of minimum required distribution for calendar years 2008 and 2009, allowing plans to permit individuals to eliminate or reduce payments or distributions during 2009. The clause allows for a waiver of minimum required distributions for calendar year 2009, with an exception for those receiving distributions through an annuity contract. An election must be made as prescribed by the Secretary. The waiver of minimum required distributions for 2009 includes exceptions for individuals with certain retirement accounts or annuities, and deferred compensation plans. Special rules apply for the suspension period. The waiver of minimum required distributions for 2009 includes exceptions for individuals with certain retirement accounts or annuities, and deferred compensation plans. The determination of distribution amounts for calendar years after 2009 is not affected by this provision. If certain conditions apply to an individual, any distribution required for 2008 or 2009 must be made in 2010 according to the Internal Revenue Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to exclude certain distributions made in 2008 or 2009 to individuals not subject to required minimum distribution rules. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to exclude certain distributions made in 2008 to individuals not subject to required minimum distribution rules. The amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007, extending rollover periods for distributions in 2008. The due date for filing tax returns for the year of distribution is either the original due date or 60 days after the enactment of the Act. For individual retirement plans, the rollover contribution limitation does not apply to distributions. The Act allows individuals to rollover distributions from inherited retirement accounts without penalty, and they are not restricted by rollover contribution limitations for individual retirement plans. For pension plans or contracts, amendments must comply with the terms of the plan during a specified period. This applies to eligible retirement plans as defined in section 402(c)(8)(B) of the Code. Amendments to pension plans or annuity contracts must adhere to specific conditions and timelines outlined in the section. For governmental plans, the deadline is extended to 2012. Amendments to pension plans or annuity contracts must adhere to specific conditions and timelines outlined in the section. From January 1, 2009, to December 31, 2009, the plan or contract is operated as if the amendment were in effect retroactively.
